title: 2 Nephi 22
html:
Sing Unto the Lord

Synopsis: In the millennial day all men shall praise the Lord—He shall dwell among them—Compare Isaiah 12.

Who Is Our Guide?

If we are to understand this large block of Isaiah chapters (2 Nephi 12–24) we must never forget why Nephi has included them. It is because he "delighteth in proving unto [his] people the truth of the coming of Christ . . . and also [his] soul delighteth in the covenants of the Lord" (2 Nephi 11:4–5).

What Are the Trees?

  • Covenant Israel (inhabitants of Zion addressed)
  • Christ (a song of praise to the Savior)
  • Coming Events (millennial conditions described)

What Keys Can We Use?

  • Learn the Manner of Prophesying (Isaiah speaks of a psalm and the symbol of a well)
  • Have the Spirit of Prophecy (read prayerfully)
  • Live in the Last Days (this chapter describes a millennial event)

Overview of 2 Nephi 22 in One Paragraph

This chapter is fairly straightforward. "In that day" (in the Millennium), all men will sing this psalm or song of thanks-giving, praising the Lord whose anger is turned away and recognizing that He is the source of strength and of salvation.

Dividing the Tree of 2 Nephi 22 into Branches

  • 1–2: A song of praise and gratitude
  • 3: Isaiah testifies: "With joy shall ye draw water out of the wells of salvation"
  • 4–6: An invitation to join in the song of praise
